news.title: Brookfield India REIT raises ₹2,000 crore through sustainability-linked bonds
news.para: Brookfield India Real Estate Trust has successfully raised Rs 2,000 crore via sustainability-linked bonds. The International Finance Corporation acted as an anchor investor. This follows a recent Rs 3,500 crore equity raise. These funds will support future growth and expansion plans. The REIT is also acquiring Ecoworld for Rs 13,125 crore. This marks significant capital raising for the company.

news.title: NGT stays order to attach Gaursons Promoters' office, case against its MD
news.para: The National Green Tribunal has temporarily halted its order to attach Gaursons Promoters Private Limited headquarters and initiate criminal proceedings against its managing director. This relief comes after the company sought a modification of the earlier directive. The tribunal will hear the matter again on January 12. Gaurs Group stated that an employee's oversight led to the issue.

news.title: Adani Group looks to build one of India’s largest hotel portfolios
news.para: Gautam Adani's conglomerate is making a significant foray into hospitality, planning over 60 hotels across its airports and real estate. This ambitious move aims to diversify revenue streams beyond aeronautical income, positioning Adani Group as a major competitor to established players like Taj and ITC Hotels. Navi Mumbai is set to be a key development hub for these new ventures.

news.title: Shree Cement locks out Baloda Bazar plant in Raipur
news.para: Starting December 18, Shree Cement has decided to implement a lockout at its Baloda Bazar facility in Chhattisgarh, driven by a lack of cooperation from the workforce. This move could lead to an estimated loss of around 10,000 tonnes of cement per day.

news.title: Lucknow development body opens registration for plots in Anantnagar scheme
news.para: The Lucknow Development Authority is opening online registrations for 637 residential plots in its Anantnagar housing scheme. The application window opens on December 20 and closes on January 12.  Allotments will be conducted through a lottery system.  The scheme offers plots ranging from 112.5 to 450 square metres.  This phase includes plots in Akash Khand and Adarsh Khand.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh empowers housing authorities to change land use for projects
news.para: Uttar Pradesh government has empowered housing development authorities by delegating land use change powers to their boards. This allows for agricultural land conversion for residential purposes for schemes of 50 acres or more, facilitating urbanisation and township development across 20 key cities. Private developers executing approved township projects will also benefit from this amendment.

news.title: ED arrests Jayathri Infrastructures' MD in real estate pre-launch fraud case
news.para: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has arrested Kakarla Srinivas, managing director of Jayathri Infrastructures India Pvt Ltd, in connection with a multi-crore real estate pre-launch fraud. Srinivas, who had been absconding, was apprehended in Chennai and remanded in judicial custody. The ED's investigation revealed alleged money laundering and diversion of Rs 61 crore generated by cheating homebuyers.

news.title: Property tax of 5,000 households set to rise as 19 roads upgraded in Patna
news.para: Patna residents face a significant property tax hike as 19 main roads are upgraded to 'principal main road' status. Over 5,000 households will see their residential property taxes increase by approximately 1.5 times. Commercial properties, including hotels and malls, will also experience substantial increases, with some facing up to double the previous tax.

news.title: Mumbai builder booked for cheating investor of crores in Mira Road land deal
news.para: A Mumbai builder, Neeraj Vora, faces cheating and forgery charges. He allegedly defrauded a Vasai businessman of crores in a Mira Road land deal. Funds were transferred for development, but the promised land was never delivered. Vora is accused of misappropriating the money and dealing with the land parcel for personal gain.

news.title: Morbi: Cheating FIR filed against eight builders for not providing basic amenities promised
news.para: A 44-year-old man has filed a cheating complaint against eight builders in Morbi, alleging they failed to provide promised basic amenities like water supply and internal roads for hundreds of houses. Despite assurances, residents discovered land documents were not mutated, preventing the village panchayat from extending civic services. Builders allegedly ignored complaints and threatened residents.

news.title: Pune: MPCB team visits Baner realty site to assess anti-pollution steps
news.para: Maharashtra Pollution Control Board officials inspected a Baner construction site to assess dust and noise pollution control measures. The National Green Tribunal directed the MPCB to ensure the project proponent implements necessary steps to keep pollution within prescribed limits, following earlier directives and submissions.

news.title: Homes sales in USA dip 1% year-on-year in November 2025
news.para: In November, American home sales experienced a modest rise from October, yet the figures fell short compared to last year’s performance. While sales may have slowed, home prices soared to an unprecedented high for the month. Many potential buyers, especially those entering the market for the first time, are grappling with affordability issues.

news.title: IFC to invest ₹300 crore in Grihum Housing Finance's RMBS
news.para: IFC is channeling up to Rs 300 crore into Grihum Housing Finance's Residential Mortgage-Backed Securities. This strategic investment is designed to broaden home ownership opportunities for low and middle-income families, paving the way for more affordable housing solutions.

news.title: Shree Cement to invest ₹2,000 crore in Maharashtra manufacturing unit
news.para: Shree Cement is investing Rs 2,000 crore in Maharashtra's Vidarbha region. A new cement manufacturing unit will be set up in Chandrapur district. This expansion is part of a three-year plan to increase the company's overall capacity. The company plans to reach 80 MTPA capacity.

news.title: Public transport must anchor urban mobility, says housing ministry
news.para: As Indian metropolises grapple with escalating pollution and relentless traffic congestion, prioritizing public transport has never been more crucial. Specialists recommend a smart urban planning strategy that promotes residential areas in proximity to workspaces.

news.title: Five roads along Jaipur metro are now transit-oriented development corridors
news.para: Jaipur Development Authority (JDA) has designated five key roads along the metro line as Transit-Oriented Development (TOD) corridors. These zones, extending 800 meters from metro stations, will mandate mixed land use, including residential, commercial, and industrial development, as per the state government's policy.

news.title: Constitute panel to regulate sand mining from Thottappally Spillway: Kerala HC tells government
news.para: The High Court has ordered the formation of an expert committee to oversee all sand and soil removal at Thottappally Spillway. This committee will assess ecological and environmental impacts. The court's decision comes after petitions challenged the district collector's order to remove sand for flood mitigation. The committee's recommendations will be crucial before any sand or soil removal proceeds.

news.title: Two REITs plan debt sales this month: Sources
news.para: In a bold financial maneuver, two Indian real estate investment trusts, Knowledge Realty Trust and Embassy Office Parks REIT, are gearing up to launch bond issuances aimed at raising a staggering 21 billion rupees.

news.title: Allahabad HC refuses to quash ED proceedings in Grand Venice case
news.para: The Allahabad High Court refused to quash ED proceedings under PMLA for the Grand Venice project, but raised questions about jurisdiction if only Section 406 IPC remains. The court directed the ED to halt coercive measures until charges are framed or a final order is passed on consolidated FIRs.
